key_title: Key to the species of Limonium

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Plumbaginaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Plumbaginaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaf margins sinuate or lobed; inflorescence branches winged
Leaves entire; inflorescence branches terete or angular, but not winged
Leaves and flowering branches glabrous, or leaves ciliate along the margin only; calyx pale blue, with 5 more or less acute, membranous lobes alternating with 5 bristle-like projections; annual
Leaves and flowering branches hispid or scabrous; calyx bright blue or purplish (rarely white), inconspicuously lobed; perennial
Leaves broadly obtuse to rounded or emarginate, to c. 5 cm long; inflorescence branches terete
Leaves acute or narrowly obtuse, mostly more than 6 cm long; inflorescence branches angular or ribbed
Calyx-lobes with midrib extended to apex; annual or short-lived perennial with slender taproot
Calyx-lobes with midrib terminating c. 0.5–1 mm below apex; perennial with rather stout, woody rootstock
